wiki.content:
"Tears in Heaven" is a ballad written by Eric Clapton and Will Jennings about the pain Clapton felt following the 1991 death of his four-year-old son, Conor, who fell from a 53rd-story window in his mother's friend's New York City condominium. By all accounts, the death was simply a tragic accident, and Clapton was distraught for months afterwards.This song is one of Clapton's most successful, reaching #2 on the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart in the U.S.
 
 It was also used as the theme song to the 1991 film "Rush".
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Tears in Heaven" is a ballad written by Eric Clapton and Will Jennings about the pain Clapton felt following the 1991 death of his four-year-old son, Conor, who fell from a 53rd-story window in his mother's friend's New York City condominium. By all accounts, the death was simply a tragic accident, and Clapton was distraught for months afterwards.This song is one of Clapton's most successful, reaching #2 on the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart in the U.S.

track.name: Tears in Heaven
comments: Can barely listen to this song. My dad listened to this one a lot before he passed away, and hearing it crushes me.
there's a great jazz version by Joshua Redman
One of the saddest songs ever penned. It rips at the heart strings as few as ever had. [2]  real talent, real sad.
May sound strange but, loove it!
So sad, it makes me cry ;(
Lost my baby boy 22yrs ago.....Love this song but gotta skip it :-(
Just saw him play this in Austin.
An amazing song. It's too bad it had to be written though. You can feel his love for his son. Just listen.
Just love this song,it is so sad.
I couldn't believe this was Clapton, I've never heard this song.
I lost 3 member's of my close family in 2012 and when i listen to this song i feel close to them x

Played this at your memorial also, Vinny...I just knew you would like it...tears on earth have flowed freely since you went away.  But I know there will be no more tears in heaven.  Love you always,  Mom
One of the saddest songs ever penned. It rips at the heart strings as few as ever had.
